intro: Kosteletzkya smilacifolia, commonly known as the swamp mallow, is a flowering plant native to wetland areas of the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist or swampy soils. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in summer. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Kosteletzkya smilacifolia plays a role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
